Description: Long-running Midwestern chain serving deep-dish & thin-crust pizzas, plus subs, salads & more.

summary.snippet: "Good Pizza , nice people, had to wait a bit."
"Not to mention the feta bread I had ordered was absolutely delicious."
"Crust burnt, cheese minimal, definitely not like it used to be."

most_relevant.description: I mean, let’s be honest, at its best, it’s corporate mass-produced pizza. My issues are the people that run it. Every orders 15 to 20 minutes late because they just sit around getting high next to all of the food equipment. Photo attached thanks for playing.

I walked in, ordered my pizza to go (take-out only), 15 minutes later, I walked out the door.  (This was a Thursday evening.  Might be different on the weekend). Pizza was excellent.  I would go back next time I'm in town.
I ordered a pizza 🍕 while at work. I picked it up before closing. The service was excellent, and the pizza was fresh and hot. 5 Stars 🌟

A couple of weeks or so ago I ordered one of the specials that included garlic cream cheese and didn't get it so I called them up and told them and they said that they would send me some when the driver got back I never got it !! And tonight I ordered something at 1:29am which was supposed to be delivered at 2:07an at 2:07am II got an email saying that it was on the way and would be delivered at 2:14am and that my driver was Billy  C but it never came and of course I got no answer from the store because they were closed so I want my 200 reward points back and whatever compensation for making me starve !!!
Honestly, the BEST pizza I have ever had. The BBQ Chicken will blow your mind!!! 11/10 would drive 2 hours to eat here again.

I'm not sure why they never have my order lately?! Past few weeks go in and they're like, "sorry I don't have that order or sorry our system is down". It's so bad that I'm not gonna go there anymore! Like 4 times! Which sucks cuz I LOVE Cottage Inn and especially because this location is supposed to be open until 4am on U of M campus area
I usually don’t leave reviews but the employees here are so rude and petty. Had a problem both times we have ordered. They didn’t even cut our pizza

Cottage Inn Pizza has always been an American institution. In my opinion. Their pizza and other options are fitted to fit even the most picky eater. With easy to please menu items such as the cinnamon Inn sticks and the ever so lovable Motor City meatball pizza. With much to offer and at affordable prices, is no loss of great quality. This is the pizza choice you want to make.
